results.title: Designer children
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Cynthia Page, Larkin McPhee, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Geneticists can now offer a cure for some of the thousands of inherited diseases. This program explores the difficult personal, moral and ethical issues arising from this situation.

results.title: Freedom in the genes
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, David Sington, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Is behaviour inherited and destined since birth? This episode from the ‘Cracking the code’ series explores this question with the aid of the world’s largest gathering of twins, English sheepdogs, trained flies plus other animal assistants.

results.title: The Mouse that laid the golden egg
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Page, Paul Gasek, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Sheep with human genes making drugs, pigs bred for organ transplantation: European and American companies are making such creatures now, but will scientists be allowed to continue to twist nature in this way?

results.title: Jane Tanner
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Jane Tanner is a Melbourne-based illustrator of children’s books, best known for her illustrations in “Time for a Rhyme” and “There’s a Sea in my Bedroom”. She and Allan Baillie, who writes the text for children’s books, are interviewed by Trevor Lunn. Jane discusses her career, what she thinks makes a good picture book and displays examples of her work as she explains her working methods. She and Allan then discuss collaborating on books.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.
